detail: New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and performs a trajectory correction maneuver using hydrazine thrusters. All subsystems report nominal status and no faults detected.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and runs an engineering telemetry downlink through the Deep Space Network station. Minor timing offsets are corrected in the attitude control system.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and executes a three-axis attitude reorientation to point the high-gain antenna at Earth. Command sequence for the next segment of the mission uplinked successfully.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and collects calibrated science data using the Ralph and Alice instruments. Data volume remains within storage and downlink allocation limits.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and records high-priority observations to the solid-state recorder for later playback. Instrument thermal conditions remain within expected operational ranges.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and performs a health check on the power, thermal, and guidance subsystems. Link margin remains adequate for current range from Earth.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and adjusts spin rate and balance for stable long-duration cruise operations. Fuel consumption remains within predicted bounds for this phase of the mission.

New Horizons is in the launch and early checkout phase near Earth and updates onboard autonomy rules for fault protection during distant operations. No anomalous behavior reported by onboard monitoring processes.
